sub_title: Visiting Scholar at UC Berkeley; Ph.D. Researcher at Technische Universiteit Delft; 知乎:大可奇；公众号:大可Offer；头条:大可奇看世界；微博&B站:大可Offer奇炁奇; I research, I meditate, I know.
summary:
I possess an interdisciplinary education and research background, with solid experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning, and Data-driven research especially in Transportation and Shared Mobility. Now, as a Ph.D. researcher, I am working on Automated Vehicles' Safety in Mix Traffic, trying to expand the Operation Design Domain of AV with data-driven deep learning methods from both aspects of perception and controlling.

I am keen on and enjoy analyzing cross-domain data, uncovering the hidden beauty of Real-World-Big-Data. I minored in Big Data Master Project during my master's years at Tsinghua University (Top 1 in China), and the IBM Deep Learning Professional Certificate program. With the board learning experience, I now can handle large scale multi-sourced heterogeneous data through distributed big data platforms and database tools.

I am a person with immense curiosity, always want to challenge myself with new areas and enjoy the pleasure of conquering one new domain after another. As a result, I gained an interdisciplinary research background (EE->Telecommunication->Automation->Transportation & Data Science & Artificial Intelligence).


In daily life, I would like to explore the world by both traveling, which is an external approach, and meditation which is an internal approach and helps me to feel and understand our world in a unique way. I also strive to pursue the inner peace whose power has been shown in Kungfu Panda, and also the force as demonstrated in the Star Wars series. The experiences of Meditation as well as Pursuing Inner Peace and The Force really help to stimulate my research inspiration, which, I believe, will continue to serve and distinguish me during my research career. 

I always feel a sense of mission and responsibility to make our world better. I see machine learning and data-driven interdisciplinary research as my tools for making a little difference in my life, to the world.


Quotes:
"If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart."
"Live in the Present Moment. Irrespective of what happened yesterday or last year, and what may or may not happen tomorrow, the present moment is where you are---always."
"Not everything that counts can be counted, and not everything that can be counted really counts." ---Alert Einstein

Data Alchemist, Buddhist-Taoist yogi, Michael Miracle~~~
yongqidong.github.io/

treasury_media.title: Data-Driven All in one Shared Mobility Platform Conceptual Design @Microsoft Discover AI Competition
treasury_media.description:
A data-driven All in one Shared Mobility Platform proposal for the 2019 Discover AI Challenge by Microsoft, Ranked top the 10th:
To build a real sustainable city transportation system, the optimization objective of ASMP is to enhance transportation efficiency at a city level for the benefit of all stakeholders rather than the benefits of the individual travelers, drivers, or TNCs. 
Interested? 

Contact for details.

treasury_media.title: IDEA League Summer School: Analysis and Modelling Road User Behaviour
treasury_media.description:
IDEA League Summer School: Analysis and Modelling Road User Behaviour.

This summer school program aims to provide with the human factors theoretical foundations for the analysis and modelling of road-user behaviour, within the context of road safety and development of driving automation systems.

projects.title: Data-driven research for expanding Automated Vehicles’ Operational Design Domain in mixed traffic (part of SAMEN project)
projects.description:
	Developed a hybrid sequence-to-one model for lane detection in extremely-hard driving scenes
	Incorporated spatio-temporal attention for automated vehicles’ perception 
	Reliable data-driven algorithms are being developed for peculiarities identification, recognition, and prediction
	State-of-the-art Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) models are being explored to develop reliable models for AVs’ driving policies under selected manoeuvres involving both longitudinal and lateral control

Research outputs:
•	A Hybrid Spatial-temporal Deep Learning Architecture for Lane Detection (Published on CACIE)
•	Aspects to Consider for Modeling Automated Driving in Microscopic Traffic Simulations: State of the Practice and Research Needs. (Published on IEEE Transactions on ITS) 
•	Car-Following Properties of a Commercial Adaptive Cruise Control System- A Pilot Field Test. (Published on Transportation Research Record: Journal of the Transportation Research Board) 
•	Robust Lane Detection through Self Pre-training with Masked Sequential Autoencoders and Fine-tuning with Customized PolyLoss (Under review by IEEE Transactions on ITS, Accepted by TRB 2023)
•	Sequential Neural Network Model with Spatial-Temporal Attention Mechanism for Robust Lane Detection Using Multi Continuous Image Frames (Under review, Accepted by TRB 2023)
•	Towards Developing Socially-Compliant Automated Vehicles: State of the Practice, Experts Expectations, and a Conceptual Framework (Accepted by MFTS 2022, to be submitted to Journal of Transport Reviews)
•	Intelligent Anomaly Detection for Lane Rendering Using Transformer with Self-Supervised Pre-Training and Customized Fine-Tuning (Submitted to the Journal of Intelligent and Connected Vehicles, and CICTP 2023).
•	Robust Lane Detection using Image Sequential Attention Based Transformer Model with Elaborated Positional Encoding (In preparation)
•	Safe, Efficient, and Social Compliant Autonomous Driving based on Deep Reinforcement Learning (In preparation)

projects.title: Applied Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Big Data Research in Transportation Domain
projects.description:
	A Deep Learning Framework for Traffic Forecasting: Exploring GCN joint with LSTM to predict traffic flow
	Data-driven anomaly/fraud detection (Unsupervised): Auto-Encoder, Hierarchical Extreme Learning Machines
	Kaggle Competition: Employ LSTM, LightGBM and XGBoost models to predict stock movements with news data
	Deep reinforcement learning in traffic control: DQN, A3C, and PPO methods
	Real-time Road Surface Condition Monitoring: Adopt Convolutional Neural Network to RSC image classification
	Optimized dynamic dispatching and operation algorithm for on-demand shared mobility by deep learning

projects.title: Research on problems of travelling in intelligent transportation area based on data driven
projects.description:
Research on problems of travelling in intelligent transportation area based on data driven
 	
Revealing New York taxi drivers’ operation patterns focusing on the revenue aspect

Develop a method to classify drivers into three different groups based on their revenue: top, ordinary, low earner 

Excavated the population operation patterns of different taxi driver groups through big data analysis and visualization methods and found that top drivers do have special operation tactics temporally and spatially

Findings are useful for not only individual taxicab driver but also for those policy-makers in city authorities
 	
Influence of on-demand car service (Didi) compared to traditional taxi services based on big data analysis

Compared the differences between traditional taxi services and on-demand car service through basic big data analysis as well as cluster methods

On-demand car service proved a successful complement to traditional taxi services temporally and spatially
Internet based ride-sharing perform unique travel patterns  see An Empirical Study on Travel Patterns of Internet Based Ride-Sharing
 	
Influence of on-demand car service on vehicle emissions
Applied big data analysis and transfer learning methods to show how on-demand car services reduced the total vehicle emissions by using PHEM model
 	
Fundamental research on intelligent parking guidance and recommendation based on data-driven method

profile_positions.description: I am visiting the Mechanical Systems Control Lab led by Professor Masayoshi Tomizuka. I focus on developing socially-compliant automated driving in mixed traffic.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Scholar

profile_positions.description:
Under SAMEN (Safe and efficient operation of AutoMated and human drivEN vehicles in mixed traffic), the research task here includes:

1) To develop reliable data-driven algorithms for peculiarities identification, recognition, and prediction on different roads and traffic conditions;
Deep Learning for Automated Vehicles' sensing in challenging environments: A Hybrid Spatial-temporal Deep Learning Architecture for Lane Detection



2) To examine and evaluate the implications of different driving strategies and driving styles of AVs on human drivers behaviour of nearby vehicles, then optimize AVs’ driving strategies and styles’ considering the interaction with HDVs and other AVs.
Deep Reinforcement Learning for Automated Vehicles' Controlling in challenging manoeuvres interacting with other road participants 

Both state-of-the-art DL and DRL are employed.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Phd Candidate
Research Assistant

company.name: ITS lab, Depart of Automation, Tsinghua University

profile_positions.company: ITS lab, Depart of Automation, Tsinghua University
profile_positions.description:
Applied Machine Learning and Big Data Analytics in Transportation and Shared Mobility Research

Revealing New York taxi drivers’ operation patterns focusing on revenue
	Developed a method for classifying drivers into 3 groups based on their revenue: top, ordinary, low earner
	Excavated the population operation patterns of different taxi driver groups through big data analytics and visualization methods, discovered that top drivers utilize special operation tactics temporally and spatially

Influence of on-demand ride services versus traditional taxi based on machine learning and big data analytics->Transportation Research Part C (Q1; IF:3.968,): An Empirical Study on Travel Patterns of Internet Based Ride-Sharing
	Uncovered the differences between the taxi and on-demand ride services using big data and clustering methods
	On-demand ride service proves to be a successful complement to traditional taxi service temporally and spatially
	Applied non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) to obtain basis patterns of Taxi, Hitch and Express service
	On-demand ride-sharing shows unique travel patterns: mainly serves as an effective approach for commuting


Influence of on-demand ride service on vehicle emissions
	Applied big data analytics and transfer learning methods to demonstrate how on-demand ride services have reduced total vehicle emissions by using the PHEM model

Fundamental research on intelligent parking guidance and recommendations based on machine learning
	Forecast models of travel time to parking lots (Random Forest);  Guidance and optimization models for parking
	Personalized recommendation research on parking (Collaborative Filtering and Content-based algorithm)

Cross-domain data fusion for full-time trip chain reconstruction and anomalies detection;

City Computing: Applying NMF methods to evaluate indicators describing urban function, land use, mobility, etc.

Revealing collective travel patterns of Shared Mobility in a spatial-temporal manner

volunteer_experiences.description:
Responsible for activities and competitions between overseas and Chinese students in Asian Youth Center project, Tsinghua University. Successfully hosted Welcome Party, Christmas Party, Badminton Competition, and so on.
 	Volunteer Leader in the 5th Joint School Symposium for the Asian Youth Center Project

company.name: School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University
